briefdescription.para: Copy string into bounded buffer and always NUL-terminate.
Return pointer to the last '/' in a path, or NULL if none.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *out, size_t outsz, const char *dir, const char *file)
memberdef.name: join_path

briefdescription.para: Join directory and filename into an output buffer.

detaileddescription.para: If dir is empty, the result is just file. Ensures NUL termination.

briefdescription.para: Read an entire file into a newly allocated NUL-terminated buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Also strips a UTF-8 BOM if present.

parameterdescription.para: Output pointer to malloc'd buffer (caller frees).

briefdescription.para: Scan a relaxed JSON blob for an integer value at key "key".

detaileddescription.para: This is a simple best-effort scanner. It does not implement full JSON.

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *json, const char *key, char *dst, size_t dstsz)
memberdef.name: scan_json_key_string

briefdescription.para: Scan a relaxed JSON blob for a string value at key "key".

detaileddescription.para: Copies up to dstsz-1 bytes and NUL-terminates.

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *json, const char *key, const char **out_begin, const char **out_end)
memberdef.name: scan_json_object_range

briefdescription.para: Locate the byte range of a JSON object value "{ ... }" for a key.

detaileddescription.para: Returns pointers to the interior (after '{') and the closing brace position (pointer to the '}' character). The range is [begin, end).

parameterdescription.para: Output end pointer (points to closing brace).

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found/malformed, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *begin, const char *end, const char *key, char *dst, size_t dstsz)
memberdef.name: scan_json_key_string_in_range

briefdescription.para: Scan for a string key within a bounded [begin,end) range.

detaileddescription.para: This is used to parse nested objects without allocating substrings.

simplesect.para: 1 if found, 0 if not found, negative on invalid args.

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, void *buf, size_t count, off_t offset)
memberdef.name: ie_pread

detaileddescription.para: Uses pread() when available; otherwise emulates with lseek+read and restores the file offset.

briefdescription.para: Open and parse IEBIN v1 metadata and resolve the weights path.

detaileddescription.para: See ie_io.h for the public contract.

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success, IE_IO_ERR_* on failure.

briefdescription.para: Touch the weights binary to verify readability.

detaileddescription.para: Touch the weights binary to verify readability (optional warm-up).
Performs small positional reads near the start and end (if file is large).

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success, IE_IO_ERR_* on error.

briefdescription.para: Close weights descriptor and release optional dedup handle.

detaileddescription.para: Close weights resources and release optional dedup handle.

The function looks for dtype in {"int4","q4","mixed"} and a "quant" object containing fields like:
per: "row" or other
scale_bin: relative path to scales
pack: packing identifier
zp: zero point
symmetric: boolean-ish

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success or when metadata not present; IE_IO_ERR_* on error.

briefdescription.para: Convert IEEE-754 half (fp16) bit-pattern to float (fp32).

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *packed_path, const char *scales_path, size_t rows, size_t cols, int per_row, float *dst)
memberdef.name: ie_weights_decode_int4

briefdescription.para: Decode packed INT4 weights + scales into float weights.

parameterdescription.para: Non-zero for per-row scales; otherwise per-tensor.

simplesect.para: IE_IO_OK on success, IE_IO_ERR_* on failure.

briefdescription.para: Implementation of the IEBIN v1 loader with relaxed JSON parsing.

sect2.title: Design Goals

listitem.para: Zero third-party dependencies (plain C, no JSON libraries).
Safety with -Werror (no unsafe formatting, careful bounds checking).

sect2.para: This module extracts minimal header info from model.ie.json and resolves the path to model.ie.bin. It also exposes a small ie_weights_touch() routine to validate OS-level readability and optionally warm caches.

sect3.title: Deduplicated weights support (lossless)
sect3.para: If a sibling model.dedup.json exists in the same directory as model.ie.json, this loader can prefer it and treat the deduplicated artifacts as the active weights source.
If those fields do not exist, dedup is simply not activated here (baseline path remains unchanged and the TU still compiles cleanly under -Werror).
